wikipedia_page.main: Blanche Forsythe was a British actress of the silent era. She was born in Islington in the mid-1880s and died in Middlesex in 1953 - aged 80.

* 1913  East Lynne - British Film - Directed by Bert Haldane - with Blanche Forsythe and Fred Paul

Jane Shore is a 1915 British silent historical film directed by Bert Haldane and F. Martin Thornton and starring Blanche Forsythe, Roy Travers and Robert Purdie. It is an adaptation of the 1714 play The Tragedy of Jane Shore by Nicholas Rowe and is based on the life of Jane Shore, the mistress of Edward IV.
* Blanche Forsythe - Jane Winstead
East Lynne is a 1913 British silent drama film directed by Bert Haldane and starring Blanche Forsythe, Fred Paul and Fred Morgan.BFI.org It is based on the 1861 novel East Lynne by Ellen Wood.
* Blanche Forsythe - Lady Isobel
* Blanche Forsythe - Agnes

response: * A British silent film called Jane Shore was directed by Bert Haldane and Floyd Martin Thornton (1915). Blanche Forsythe played Jane Shore. The film was based on Rowe's play.

Tommy Atkins is a 1915 British silent war film directed by Bert Haldane and starring Blanche Forsythe, Jack Tessier and Roy Travers. It is based on an 1895 play of the same title by Ben Landeck and Arthur Shirley.Goble p.425
* Blanche Forsythe as Ruth Raymond

The Rogues of London is a 1915 British silent thriller film directed by Bert Haldane and starring Blanche Forsythe, Fred Paul and Maud Yates.Low p.299
* Blanche Forsythe as Ruth Davies
Sixty Years a Queen is a 1913 British silent historical film directed by Bert Haldane and starring Blanche Forsythe, Louie Henri and Fred Paul.
* Blanche Forsythe as Queen Victoria (younger)

The cinema opened on 19 May 1915, featuring Blanche Forsythe in Jane Shore; it was described at the time as "Roman-Corinthian of the later Renaissance influence". It dates from the period when the first permanent cinemas were being built, with the distinctive design acting as "ostentatious advertising". The cinema had a capacity of just under 1000 people, making it the largest cinema outside London in its day. A billiard hall was installed in the basement in the 1930s.
The Lure of Drink is a 1915 British silent drama film directed by A. E. Coleby and starring Blanche Forsythe and Roy Travers.Low p.293
* Blanche Forsythe as Peggy
* Blanche Forsythe as Ustane
Trapped by the London Sharks is a 1916 British silent drama film directed by  L.C. MacBean and starring Humberston Wright, Blanche Forsythe and Bertram Burleigh.Palmer p.877
* Blanche Forsythe as Hilda Manton
